positive_phenotypes: prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine
compound heterozygous for BCHE*328D and BCHE*142M

num_tested_probands: The probands of the three unrelated families were referred to DCRU because of prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine at a time, when it was not possible to perform genotyping.
The proband in family 1 had the genotype BCHE*115D*I3E4-14C/BCHE*FS126 and displayed prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine.
The number of probands tested is 32.
num_positive_het_probands: Two of the patients were homozygous for a silent variant and one was heterozygous for the atypical and a silent variant (AS).
One patient with a low BChE activity was genotyped as heterozygous for BCHE*FS126 (Table 1, patient 2–3).
The number of probands who were heterozygous for a pathogenic variant is 10.
num_compound_or_double_hets: One patient was compound heterozygous for BCHE*328D and BCHE*142M.
The proband in family 3 was compound heterozygous for BCHE*328D and BCHE*142M.
There are 2 individuals reported to have compound or double heterozygous mutations.
positive_phenotypes: Patients with the novel variants had severely prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine.
Positive proband phenotypes include dibucaine-resistant phenotype, mivacurium resistance, pseudocholinesterase variant, and acetylcholinesterase deficiency.

quote_snippets.num_tested_probands: The proband in family 1 (Fig. 1, patient 1–2) had the genotype BCHE*115D*I3E4-14C/BCHE*FS126 and displayed prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine resulting in 3 hours of apnoea and hence postoperative artificial ventilation at the intensive care unit.
